fields.description:
When sharing a screen with another user in a different timezone or when capturing a screenshot, the timezone is not apparent at-a-glance. Whenever date and time information is displayed, the timezone information should also be displayed. As such, one should not leave off the timezone either because it is equally important and just as confusing when the timezone is not present. One should not have to guess at the timezone.

This is a pervasive issue throughout the industry. Lead the way by providing this vital information across your entire product line.
fields.summary: Display Time Zone Information Team Calendars

fields.description:
h2. Summary

The error we're seeing in Synchrony is a core dump with
{code:java}
V  [libjvm.so+0xd6f768]  Unsafe_GetInt+0x174
{code}
We're affected by this bug in a library called *lz4* for *sparcv9* hardware which is fixed, but not in the latest release *1.3*.
 * [https://github.com/lz4/lz4-java/issues/66]

The change went from checking the OS is *Solaris* to *Solaris* and *SunOS* which is what you're machine is reporting. The code change included going from
{code:java|title=src/java/net/jpountz/util/Native.java}
} else if (osName.contains("Solaris")) {
{code}
to
{code:java|title=src/java/net/jpountz/util/Native.java}
} else if (osName.contains("Solaris") || osName.contains("SunOS")) {
{code}
plus some other bits.

So, the library *lz4 1.3* is used by a library we use called *nippy 2.12.0*.
 * [https://github.com/ptaoussanis/nippy]

And *nippy 2.12.0* is used in a library called *faraday 1.9.0*.
 * [https://github.com/ptaoussanis/faraday]

And we use Faraday.

Synchrony in Confluence Sever doesn't need Faraday. It's a hangover from the Cloud version of Synchrony that we haven't removed.
h2. Environment
 * {{sparcv9}} hardware
 * OS reported as {{SunOS}}

h2. Actual Results

It crashed with a Core Dump
{code:java}
#
# A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:
#
#  SIGBUS (0xa) at pc=0xffffffff7dd6f768, pid=27534, tid=0x0000000000000002
#
# JRE version: Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (8.0_112-b15) (build 1.8.0_112-b15)
# Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (25.112-b15 mixed mode solaris-sparc compressed oops)
# Problematic frame:
# V  [libjvm.so+0xd6f768]  Unsafe_GetInt+0x174
#
# Core dump written. Default location: /var/atlassian/application-data/confluence/core or core.27534
#
# An error report file with more information is saved as:
# /var/atlassian/application-data/confluence/hs_err_pid27534.log
Compiled method (nm)   23801 1310     n 0       sun.misc.Unsafe::getInt (native)
 total in heap  [0xffffffff6a662a10,0xffffffff6a662db8] = 936
 relocation     [0xffffffff6a662b38,0xffffffff6a662b58] = 32
 main code      [0xffffffff6a662b60,0xffffffff6a662db0] = 592
 metadata       [0xffffffff6a662db0,0xffffffff6a662db8] = 8
#
# If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit:
#   http://bugreport.java.com/bugreport/crash.jsp
#
{code}
h2. Expected Results

It works.
h2. Workaround

None
h2. Notes

Although Solaris is not a supported platform, many enterprises use it, and this issue is using a library that we don't use in serverland.

This is here to track
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/WD-828
fields.summary: Synchrony on sparcv9 server crashed with Code Dump on V [libjvm.so+0xd6f768] Unsafe_GetInt+0x174

fields.description:
Pretty straight forward. When you comment on a page and want to know if someone has replied, your only option is to watch the ENTIRE page.

There should be a little tickbox (maybe even make it automatic?) next to the current one under the comment WYSIWYG editor that says "Watch only this thread".

This way I will only see direct replies to the comment thread I am a part of, as opposed to all other comments and updates to the page body.

 

Think of the way that Reddit and other comment-based systems work online: You don't get a inbox notification for every comment or change to a reddit submission - you just get an inbox notification for replies to your own comments. :)
fields.summary: Tickbox to Watch/Subcribe only to given comment thread, as opposed to the whole page.

fields.description:
Concerning the following pages:
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/running-confluence-behind-nginx-with-ssl-858772080.html]
and
 [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-use-nginx-to-proxy-requests-for-confluence-313459790.html]

It would be incredibly helpful to see the client_max_body_size directive added to both the /confluence and /synchrony location blocks with some clarifying comments.

Context:
 The default value for client_max_body_size in nginx is 1MB:
 [http://nginx.org/en/docs/http/ngx_http_core_module.html#client_max_body_size]

In the /confluence location block, this value should directly correlate to the "Attachment Maximum Size" under "General Configuration" and should be noted as such in the aforementioned documentation.  A client_max_body_size lower than the "Attachment Maximum Size" will cause HTTP 413 errors ("Request Entity Too Large") when uploading attachments that exceed the client_max_body_size.  Matching these values will allow Confluence to display a more user-friendly error if the attachment is too large: "\{attachment-name} is too big to upload. Files must be less than \{attachment-maximum-size} MB."

In the /synchrony location block, the default 1MB value is too small for editing certain page sizes in versions 6.0+.  This will result in HTTP 413 errors in the browser console when attempting to edit the page while the UI displays the "Loading the editor's taking longer than usual..." error message but will never proceed.  Adding the client_max_body_size directive with a slightly higher value here can resolve issues with editing larger pages.

I know Atlassian's philosophy is that reverse proxies are allowed but the support team does not provide assistance for configuring them.  If documentation is already supplied to the current detail, it may make sense to add these fundamental directives to the sample configuration with some helpful comments.  This would enable admins to proactively prevent inconsistent attachment upload and Synchrony editor loading errors if they are following that documentation to the letter, as I myself had done.
fields.summary: Add client_max_body_size to Nginx documentation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The Firefox [WebDAV Launcher|https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/webdav-launcher/] is currently not compatible with Firefox 57.0, which is the most recent release as of this case. This release is known as Firefox Quantum.
h3. Suggested Solution

Do we have plans to release a version of the WebDAV Launcher soon that is compatible with this version of Firefox?
h3. Why this is important

Many users will be upgrading to Firefox 57 Quantum, so it would be helpful to have the extension be compatible with this.
h3. Workarounds
 # Do not upgrade to Firefox Quantum as it is listed as not compatible with the WebDAV Launcher: [WebDAV Launcher – Add-ons for Firefox|https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/webdav-launcher/]
 # Use Internet Explorer to 'Edit in Office'
 # If you have already upgraded to Firefox Quantam, the following steps will allow you downgrade your Firefox Browser: [Install an older version of Firefox|https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/install-older-version-of-firefox]

{panel:title=Atlassian update - 17 June 2019|borderStyle=none|borderColor=#6554c0|titleBGColor=#eae6ff|bgColor=#eae6ff}

Please see our Community post for the latest update: 
[Changes to the Companion App in Confluence 6.15.5 and 6.13.6|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-articles/Changes-to-the-Companion-App-in-Confluence-6-15-5-and-6-13-6/ba-p/1108896]

Thanks
Makisa | Senior Product Manager, Confluence Server
{panel}
 
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of August 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa} 
Hi all,

Thank you for your patience on this issue.

We are pleased to announce that the new [Edit Files|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/edit-files-170494553.html] experience is here. From Confluence 6.11 ([release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-6-11-release-notes-953678666.html]). Now, you can edit any file attached to a Confluence page using your preferred desktop application, then save the file back to Confluence automatically. The new Atlassian Companion app works across Windows and Mac operating systems with any of our supported Browsers.

Best,

Victoria Li | Product Manager - Confluence Server {panel}
fields.summary: Firefox 57.0 WebDav Launcher Extension

fields.description:
Our macro embellishes the table by adding row headers (numbered rows) along with table headers and footer. These additions are styled to match the current Confluence styling (confluenceTh,...). This styling and additions then causes Confluence to disable sticky for the table. It appears as if a sequences of actions is being done by Confluence. First by the Confluence table sort feature and then by the sticky headers feature. We really can't control which gets done when.

It does seem like the checks being made against a table to determine if it qualifies for sticky are pretty aggressive. Specifically {{areAllConfluenceThInTheSameRow}} and maybe {{areAllAdjacentCellsConfluenceTh}}. I understand what's trying to be accomplished by those checks.

Ideally, I think if Confluence fired an event that we could listen for when it's completely done processing the table( table sort, sticky, ...) then our code could know when it needs to run and do its work. As it is we can't control the order of things very well.
fields.summary: JavaScript API for sticky tables

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On a fresh install of Confluence 6.1.x, we get warnings during the startup that the c3p0 properties are being ignored and the Hibernate built-in connection pool will be used instead.

h3. Environment

* Confluence 6.1.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Fresh install
# Restart the application
# Tail the atlassian-confluence.log

h3. Expected Results

No warning is shown and c3p0 properties are applied.

h3. Actual Results

The following warnings are printed:

{code}
2017-04-18 10:11:51,380 WARN [AtlassianEvent::CustomizableThreadFactory-4] [jdbc.connections.internal.ConnectionProviderInitiator] instantiateC3p0Provider HHH000022: c3p0 properties were encountered, but the c3p0 provider class was not found on the classpath; these properties are going to be ignored.
2017-04-18 10:11:51,386 WARN [AtlassianEvent::CustomizableThreadFactory-4] [hibernate.orm.connections.pooling] configure HHH10001002: Using Hibernate built-in connection pool (not for production use!)
{code}

h3. Notes

After a deeper analysis, we identified that the warnings are harmless and are caused by a schema check before the complete startup of Hibernate. With that said, after the check and the complete startup of Hibernate, the c3p0 properties are successfully applied so we can safely ignore the warnings.

h3.Workaround

No known workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: c3p0 Class not Found on the Classpath and its Properties are Ignored

Upon clicking the save button after updating, the warning disappears. This makes the form jump up. Because of the jump, the click on the button fails to register and the button needs to be clicked again.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In order to embed a dynamic list of tweets using the [Widget Connector Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/widget-connector-macro-171180449.html], it mentions that Twitter will provide an URL to insert in on the Widget Connector Macro. However, twitter provides and HTML code that you can only use using the HTML Macro.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Twitter, go to Settings > Widgets and create a widget to display the tweets you want to embed (for example, a user timeline, list of tweets or hashtag search).
# An HTML code will be generated instead of URL as mentioned in the Documentation: [Widget Connector Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/widget-connector-macro-171180449.html].

h3. Expected Results

To be able to use the HTML code you have to enable the HTML using in Confluence which can be insecure.

h3. Actual Results

The Widget Macro is not able to handle the HTML code since it expects an URL.


h3.Workaround

Use the HTML Macro to handle the HTML code provided by Twitter.
fields.summary: Widget Macro doesn't render new format of Twitter widgets

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A customer reported that the configuration for synchrony proxy is incorrect. They are not able to configure synchrony with IIS according to our documentation. 
*According to our documentation*
We specific the synchrony configuration in web.config
{code}
<rewrite>
    <rules>
        <clear />
        <rule name="Synchrony HTTP" stopProcessing="true">
            <match url="ˆsynchrony/(.*)" />
            <conditions logicalGrouping="MatchAll" trackAllCaptures="false" />
            <action type="Rewrite" url="http://localhost:8091/synchrony/{R:1}" />
        </rule>
        <rule name="Synchrony Web Sockets Reverse Proxy" stopProcessing="true">
            <match url="ws://(.*)" />
            <conditions logicalGrouping="MatchAll" trackAllCaptures="false" />
            <action type="Rewrite" url="ws://localhost:8091/{R:1}" />
        </rule>
        <rule name="Confluence Reverse Proxy" stopProcessing="true">
            <match url="(.*)" />
            <conditions logicalGrouping="MatchAll" trackAllCaptures="false" />
            <action type="Rewrite" url="http://localhost:8090/{R:1}" />
        </rule>
    </rules>
</rewrite>
{code}
(i) The synchrony is not working when user configure the synchrony with the line *<match url="ˆsynchrony/(.*)" />* (there is a ˆ infront of synchrony). The user have the remove the ˆ symnol in order to make it works. *<match url="synchrony/(.*)" />*

h3. Suggestion
Please review this documentation and update the configuration: https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=833931378
fields.summary: Synchrony IIS proxy configuration documentation error

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Uploading some PPTX files to Confluence can cause OutOfMemory error while generating preview.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload a Powerpoint file with 300 pages containing graphs/pictures to Confluence (attached, 9.87MB)
 # Open file in preview window several times

h3. Expected Results

Confluence should pre-calculate the resource commitment before previewing the document. Similar to CONFSERVER-45209
h3. Actual Results

Confluence became unresponsive. The below exception is thrown in the catalina.out file:
{noformat}
11-Jan-2018 14:19:12.170 SEVERE [http-nio-8090-ClientPoller-1] org.apache.tomcat.util.net.NioEndpoint$Poller.run
 java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap spaceException in thread "C3P0PooledConnectionPoolManager[identityToken->1bqxcmo9s1qzxzgfaa24s0|4be2e790]-HelperThread-#1" java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space

11-Jan-2018 14:20:25.883 SEVERE [http-nio-8090-ClientPoller-0] org.apache.tomcat.util.net.NioEndpoint$Poller.run
 java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
{noformat}
Heap Dump Analysis

!image-2018-01-11-14-39-35-539.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Upgrade the Document Conversion add-on with the latest version, below
 * Download the right *document-conversion-library-x.x.xx.jar*
||Confluence version ||Document Library  Version||
|6.0 - 6.4|Document conversion [1.2.25|https://packages.atlassian.com/maven-closedsource-use1/com/atlassian/plugins/document-conversion-library/1.2.25/document-conversion-library-1.2.25.obr] ([mirror|https://drive.google.com/file/d/1oqv9iuJDnsxE_aRRRMOQ6Yc0DHOoJlnl/view?usp=sharing])|
|h4. after 6.4|Document conversion [2.0.2.1|https://packages.atlassian.com/maven-closedsource-local/com/atlassian/plugins/document-conversion-library/2.0.2.1/document-conversion-library-2.0.2.1.jar] |

 * Install the add on by file upload, as per [installing plugins |https://confluence.atlassian.com/upm/installing-add-ons-273875715.html#Installingadd-ons-Installingbyfileupload]

 

*STEP TO REPLICATE*
 # Create a PPTX files and include multiple *charts* in the PPTX file.
 # Attach the file in the Confluence page.
 # Preview the file.

*EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR*
 * The thumbnails for the PPTX file will load correctly.
 * The file will preview correctly in Confluence.

*ACTUAL BEHAVIOUR*
 * Thumbnails for the file will not load.
 * The preview will take sometime depending on the number and complexity of the Charts inside the file.

fields.description:
h2. Summary
AWS Confluence CloudFormation template creates install and home directory as root so the setup assistant will not load and users get the error documented in the Knowledge Base article [Confluence does not start due to Spring Application context has not been set|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/confluence-does-not-start-due-to-spring-application-context-has-not-been-set-218278311.html].

h2. Environment
AWS Confluence CloudFormation DataCenter template: 
https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-aws-deployment

h2. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install using the Confluence CloudFormation template from AWS

h2. Expected Results
The Confluence Setup Assistant will launch properly.

h2. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown after entering the license and the setup assistant does not complete the process:
{code:java}
2010-06-18 21:54:45,432 INFO [main] [com.atlassian.confluence.lifecycle] init Confluence is ready to serve
2010-06-18 21:55:20,515 FATAL [http-8080-1] [atlassian.spring.container.SpringContainerContext] getComponent Spring Application context has not been set
2010-06-18 21:55:20,528 ERROR [http-8080-1] [[Standalone].[localhost].[/].[action]] log Servlet.service() for servlet action threw exception
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Spring Application context has not been set
 at com.atlassian.spring.container.SpringContainerContext.getComponent(SpringContainerContext.java:48)
 at com.atlassian.spring.container.ContainerManager.getComponent(ContainerManager.java:32)
 at com.atlassian.confluence.security.seraph.ConfluenceElevatedSecurityGuard.getCaptchaManager(ConfluenceElevatedSecurityGuard.java:115){code}

h2. Notes
In the [CloudFormation template|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-aws-deployment] it appears the permissions are being set to root and not the confluence user because the root user is creating the directories (line 164):
{code:borderStyle=solid}
"inline": "sudo mkdir -p /opt/atlassian/bin && sudo mv /tmp/atl-update-host-name.sh /opt/atlassian/bin/atl-update-host-name.sh && sudo chmod +x /opt/atlassian/bin/atl-update-host-name.sh && sudo chown root:root /opt/atlassian/bin/atl-update-host-name.sh"
{code}

However, we see here the confluence user is created and the directories defined:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
    "user":                     "confluence",
    "user_id":                  "1001", 
{code}
{code:borderStyle=solid}
    "home_dir":                 "/var/atlassian/application-data/confluence",
    "install_dir":              "/opt/atlassian/confluence", 
{code}

h2. Workaround
# Stop Confluence
# Move the confluence-home directory and it's contents to /tmp (don't delete it until you confirm the application works)
# As root, impersonate the confluence user using: {{sudo su - confluence}}
# As the confluence user, start Confluence back up via: {{<confluence-install>/bin/start-confluence.sh}}
# Doing this will cause the confluence-home directory to be recreated with the proper permissions
# Complete the setup process

h5. If you have further permissions issues:
# Stop Confluence
# Confirm the confluence user is the owner and has 755 permissions, by doing these:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
$ ls -la /path/to/confluence-home
$ ls -la /path/to/confluence-install
{code}
# If the user doesn't have full read/write permissions and/or is not the owner, change the permissions for the install and home directory using the commands below
{code:java}
 chown -R confluence.confluence <confluence-install-folder>
 chown -R confluence.confluence <confluence-home-folder>
 chmod -R u=rwX,go-rwx <confluence-install-folder>
 chmod -R u=rwX,go-rwx <confluence-home-folder>
 {code}
# Restart Confluence as the confluence user
fields.summary: AWS Confluence DC Cloud Formation template creates install/home directories as root

h3. Summary

Creating PDF export of page that has status macro, will not render background color of that macro in PDF if the context path is not to set to root "/".
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Update Base URL to reflect URL with context path. (eg. http://confluence.com/confluence)
 # Create Page with Status macro.
 # Create PDF export of that page.

h3. Expected Results

Page will be exported with proper styling and background colors for status macro.
 [^610-1-120417-0756-2.pdf]
h3. Actual Results

Page will be exported with without styling and background colors for status macro.
 [^610-1-120417-0744-2.pdf]

Remove context path and use application without it.

fields.description:
It would be an improvement if the following was implemented:

When a user goes to share a page, it should also give them the option to give view/write access to the page, similar to Google drive, so that the user does not share a page to people who don't have access. Right now, users have to remember to go to the permissions and grant the users access after/before sharing the page. This should just be an option upon sharing the page.
fields.summary: Improve page sharing permissions behavior

fields.description:
h3. Steps
 # Upload an image
 # Save the page
 # Notice that it looks like it's a really small image scaled up
 # Wonder why

It's not really consistent but it seems like uploading an @2x image for the first time on a page is showing a really bad-looking version of it on the page (view, not edit). It looks fine in FileViewer and some times replacing the image (select and drop same file on to replace) fixes it.

h3. Workaround
# Edit the page
# Select the image to bring up the image toolbar
# Resize the image to another size
# Resize it back again to the desire size immediately
# Save the page
fields.summary: adding an image in edit mode adds "confluence-thumbnail" class unnecessarily causing poor image to be displayed

fields.description:
A new Space or Global Permission should be added, "View Comments". This should cover both inline and the comments under the page.  Reason behind this change is it adds functionality for those using the space for documentation. It allows us to use comments internally for review purposes, without having our conversations visible to anonymous users. By adding this permission, we can set comments to available for confluence users within a space, but set it to "No" for anonymous users, ensuring they can see the content, but will not see conversations between doc team members, or highlights from inline comments. 

I realize we can restrict access to the page, and then delete comments prior to exposing the page, but if someone finds an issue on existing documentation, it would be simpler to be able to comment on it, without exposing it publically. Does this make sense? If such a thing exists and I'm not aware of it, please let me know. Otherwise it seems a simple and very welcome change.
fields.summary: Comments Feature for Confluence

fields.description:

Currently, the WidgetConnector does not support the embed.ustudio.com domain.
fields.summary: Whitelable ustudio.com video embeds for Widget Connector

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

If you use an external tool for user management(Jira, LDAP or other) in Confluence and intend to create a group called 'confluence-administrators' there instead of the internal one(let's say you deleted it), you can. But, when you go in Confluence Global Permissions to add it and edit its permissions, you can't edit the group permissions. See attached.

h3. Suggested Solution

Confluence admins should be able to create a group with this name, even know that this is the name of one of the 2 special groups of Confluence. See [Confluence Groups|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Groups].
 
h3. Workaround 

The only workaround possible is to set a similar name like "confluence-admins".
fields.summary: Not able to user 'confluence-administrators' group name in external(Jira, LDAP, etc) group

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence does not preview Powerpoint files when fonts are missing even if the font files are not used in the Powerpoint file being previewed

h3. Environment

* Confluence 6.0.5
* CentOS 6

h3. Steps to Reproduce

*Support was unable to replicate this problem on our end*, however we managed to figure out the cause of the issue was due to a font being missing from the system

h3. Expected Results

Confluence would show the preview of the Powerpoint files that does not use that font

h3. Actual Results

When clicking on the file to preview it, it will instead state the following :

"We can't preview this file. You'll have to download the file to view it"

Also there will be an error message regarding the conversion of the Powerpoint files :

{code}
2017-03-21 16:23:44,513 ERROR [conversion-thread-0] [plugins.conversion.impl.TimeoutConversionRunnable] run Cannot convert. Execution error: 
...
Caused by: class com.aspose.slides.ms.pbdb106a0.i: FontFamily 'FreeMono' not found
Parameter name: FreeMono
com.aspose.slides.ms.pbdb106a0.p6a2feef8.q.do(Unknown Source)
{code}

h3. Workaround

Right now, the workaround is to install the font that is listed as missing. However, the reasoning behind this bug is that even if a font is missing, if the file does not use that font, the preview should be working but it's not
fields.summary: Powerpoint files does not preview due to missing font

fields.description:
Microsoft Powerpoint provides several kinds of bullet points. However, not all of them renders properly in Powerpoint Macro.

h5. Steps to Replicate
# Upload  [^testbulletpoint.ppt] to a Confluence Page
# Insert Powerpoint Macro
# Display  [^testbulletpoint.ppt] 

h5. Expected Results
Powerpoint macro renders each bullet point properly

h5. Actual Results
 [^resultbulletpoint.docx]  (This is a word export of the page)
Some bullet points doesn't render properly.

h5. Workaround
* Powerpoint macro do render single filled (•) or unfilled dot just fine. Please avoid using other bullet point for now.
* Switch to File Preview Macro instead.

In some occasions, this issue can also be resolved by installing the [Windings Fonts|https://freefontsvault.com/download/wingdings/] in Confluence server or by using the following system property and pointing it to a fonts repository having the Windings font.
{code}
-Dconfluence.document.conversion.fontpath=/path/to/fonts/folder
{code}
(i) Thanks [~7508a54bb8b0] for this suggestion

Read more about this in the guide: [The text in a PowerPoint, Excel or Word Document is missing or looks different via Confluence View File macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/the-text-in-a-powerpoint-excel-or-word-document-is-missing-or-looks-different-via-confluence-view-file-macro-200213562.html]

fields.description:
The Confluence drafts diff rest resource made the current content of all blogs and pages in Confluence available without authentication by providing a page id or draft id. Attackers who can access the Confluence web interface of a vulnerable version can use this vulnerability to obtain the content of all blogs and pages inside Confluence provided that they first enumerate page or draft ids.

*Affected versions:*
 * All versions of Confluence starting with 6.0.0 before version 6.0.7 are affected by this vulnerability.

*Fix:*
 * *Confluence* 6.1.1 is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download].
 * *Confluence* 6.1.0 is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives].
 * *Confluence* 6.0.7 is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives].

 

*Risk Mitigation:*

If you are unable to upgrade right now, this issue can be mitigated in vulnerable versions of Confluence by disabling Collaborative editing as per the following instructions.
 # Go to   !https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/887071137/image2017-4-5_14-18-41.png!  > *General Configuration* > *Collaborative editing*.
 # Change the collaborative editing mode to *Off*. *Be aware that shared drafts will be lost when you switch to this mode, so make sure your users have published any work they want to keep before you make the change.*
 # Refresh the page and check that the Collaborative editing mode has changed to "OFF".

 
 *Acknowledgements*
 We would like to credit *Yuvanesh* for reporting this issue to us.

 

For additional details see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/oaHfN].
fields.summary: Unauthenticated users can view the content of Confluence blogs and pages (CVE-2017-7415)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When reviewing AJS logs it is difficult to spot exceptions in production, but especially in development.
* Currently exceptions are logged at the LOG level rather than the ERROR level
* This does not follow the standard convention of placing exceptions at the ERROR level
* Developers are unable to easily filter out the LOG level information from the ERROR level information. Filtering just for ERROR level generates no results

h3. Suggested Solution
* Separate errors and exceptions from the normal LOG level by sorting them into the ERROR level or higher, per normal conventions
* Add extra information on errors (and make it more noticeable) if the AJS.debugEnabled() is on. This can include stack traces, etc if available.
* Provide the option to adjust logging output levels
fields.summary: Improve client side error handling and logging for AJS

h3. Actual Results

ORDER BY usr.lowerName].  Positional parameter are considered deprecated; use named parameters or JPA-style positional parameters instead.
2017-04-03 11:23:48,630 WARN [http-nio-5610-exec-1] [confluence.impl.hibernate.ConfluenceHibernateTransactionManager] doRollback Performing rollback. Transactions:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-52132].
  {panel}

Reason:
Efficient user management for license count.

Implementation:
Under Admin section, add an option to manage inactive users near license details or under license details.
When clicked, it shows
UI:
“Mark user(s) inactive for license count if user has not logged more than [BOX] days.”
Note: Where “BOX” would take any positive integer larger than 7 days.

Check here to “Run now”. [Click box]

Feature on backend:
1. Confluence checks this automatically every and marks user inactive for license count until user logs in again.
2. Runs the same operation as in #1 when admin clicks “Run now”. Displays the log entry of users marked inactive on screen besides adding it in the confluence log.

Logging:
Confluence log should have entry like:
User <user-id> was last logged on <date/time> marking it inactive for license count based on “[BOX]” day on in-activity configuration at <date & time stamp>.
fields.summary: Enhancement request regarding the user management(license)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-52115].
  {panel}

A recent update to Confluence changed the way pages are saved/published after editing.  There are now two buttons: "Update" and "Save and Close".  It's not immediately apparent what these do.

My first guess was that "Update" would incorporate any changes published by my colleagues into the draft I'm currently working on.  Instead "Update" actually _publishes_ the draft that you're currently working on.  Thus, the "Update" button would more clearly communicate its purpose with the text "Publish".

My first guess for the "Save and Close" button was that it would publish the draft I'm currently working on and return me to viewing the page.  This is similar to how Confluence previously worked.  Instead, this button saves the current draft and returns to viewing the current published version of the page.  This has confused some of my colleagues as well who frantically state that Confluence just lost all their work!  Instead of "Save and Close", this button should read "Save _Draft_ and Close" (without the emphasis of course).

*These changes would really help people understand what the buttons do and prevent literally _hours_ of frustration from people re-creating all their work that is already available in a draft!*
fields.summary: Change "Save and Close" to "Save Draft and Close"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When migrating from Confluence Single Node to Confluence Data Center, the 'Remember Me' option is set to true by default. This behavior is to ensure session affinity in case the load balancer was not properly set with session stickiness.
This is not properly communicated neither in our [Confluence Cookies Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-cookies-160794071.html] neither from the UI

h3. Suggested Solution
We can handle this in multiple ways:
# We can display the 'Remember Me' automatically checked by default and the user can uncheck it if needed
# In case, where we need to enforce this, we can show it checked but greyed out and the user cannot unckeck it. We can also add a link to a KB where we explain why we have set this to true by default

h3. Workaround
If you want to disable the Remeber Me by default in Confluence Data Center, our initial KB article [How to disable the 'Remember Me' feature in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-disable-the-remember-me-feature-in-confluence-118686062.html] did not include the Data Center option. I updated the article to reflect on this.
fields.summary: Enhance visibility of 'Remember Me' set to true by default in Confluence Data Center

Hello.

 

One of our customers made the following suggestion:

The requirement is to Integrate text highlighter into Confluence WYSIWYG editor, implement it into menu bar: section text fonts parameters …

!conf.png!

Like in every standard program / e.g. example from Word.

!word.png!

To allow changing text background color as it present on test page everywhere in the text, including standard paragraphs, heading and inside of tables also …

!example.png!

 

Is there maybe already a ticket for that?

Is Atlassian planning to do that?

 

BR,

Mladen Magic
fields.summary: Integrate text highlighter

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-52105].
  {panel}

h3. Summary 
When a user is disabled in LDAP, all his previous page and space watches are still stored in the {{notifications}} table in the Confluence database. This results in the issue in this KB to occur: 
* [Email notifications trigger a NoSuchElementException in the logs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/email-notifications-trigger-a-nosuchelementexception-in-the-logs-747443312.html/] 

Those entries need to be manually removed for each disabled user and can be undesirable once you have a large number of disabled users. 

h3. Suggestion 
Automatically remove a user's watch subscriptions once they've been transitioned to 'Disabled'.
fields.summary: Automatically remove an LDAP user's watch subscriptions once they are disabled

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamkb/the-component-of-the-database-name-of-the-object-qualifier-must-be-the-name-of-the-current-database-879008646.html

h3. Summary
Confluence throws a database error while trying to upgrade to 6.1.0 when using Microsoft SQL Server database:

{code}

Caused by: com.atlassian.config.ConfigurationException: Cannot update schema
	at bucket.core.persistence.hibernate.schema.SchemaHelper.validateSchemaUpdateIfNeeded(SchemaHelper.java:174)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager.upgrade(AbstractUpgradeManager.java:119)
	... 11 more
Caused by: org.hibernate.exception.GenericJDBCException: Error accessing table metadata
	at org.hibernate.exception.internal.StandardSQLExceptionConverter.convert(StandardSQLExceptionConverter.java:47)

	at org.hibernate.tool.schema.internal.SchemaMigratorImpl.doMigration(SchemaMigratorImpl.java:136)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.impl.hibernate.ConfluenceHibernateSchemaManagementTool$3.doMigration(ConfluenceHibernateSchemaManagementTool.java:105)
	at org.hibernate.tool.schema.internal.SchemaMigratorImpl.doMigration(SchemaMigratorImpl.java:109)
	at org.hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl.SchemaUpdate.execute(SchemaUpdate.java:87)

	at org.hibernate.tool.schema.extract.internal.InformationExtractorJdbcDatabaseMetaDataImpl.locateTableInNamespace(InformationExtractorJdbcDatabaseMetaDataImpl.java:337)
	... 21 more
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Microsoft SQL Server database named *Confluence*.
# Install Confluence lower than 6.1.0.
# Connect Confluence to the Microsoft SQL Server database using the connection string url as *confluence* (instead of Confluence with an uppercase letter C).
# Upgrade Confluence 6.1.0

h3. Expected Results
* Upgrade is successful.

h3. Actual Results
* Upgrade fails with
{noformat}
Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: The database name component of the object qualifier must be the name of the current database.
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
# Get the name of the Microsoft SQL Server database using the following SQL statement:
{code:sql}
SELECT name, database_id, create_date FROM sys.databases;
{code}
# Compare it with the database name configured inside the {{<confluence_home>/confluence.cfg.xml}} file:
#* Or in the *server.xml* file if you are using *data source* connection.
{noformat}
jdbc:jtds:sqlserver://<host>:<port>/<database name>
{noformat}
# Update the database name so it matches the exact name of the database from the SQL statement.
# Restart Confluence.
fields.summary: On upgrade to Confluence 6.1, an error 'The database name component of the object qualifier must be the name of the current database' occurs

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence attachment is rendered as a broken link when viewed in JIRA Activity Stream gadget from JIRA and Activity Stream gadget from Confluence.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 6.1.0, 6.1.2
 * JIRA 7.3.3, 7.3.5

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up application links between JIRA and Confluence
 # Add attachment in an existing Confluence page
 # See JIRA Activity Stream gadget from JIRA Dashboard

h3. Expected Results

The attachment is rendered correctly
h3. Actual Results
 * The attachment is rendered as a broken link
 * Opening the attachment in a new tab will result in a System Error page with below error:

{noformat}
Cause
java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.atlassian.confluence.servlet.download.AttachmentDownload.getStreamForDownload(AttachmentDownload.java:105)
Stack Trace:[hide]
java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.atlassian.confluence.servlet.download.AttachmentDownload.getStreamForDownload(AttachmentDownload.java:105)
at com.atlassian.confluence.servlet.download.ServeAfterTransactionDownload$StreamResultCallback.doInTransaction(ServeAfterTransactionDownload.java:110)
at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate.execute(TransactionTemplate.java:133)
at com.atlassian.confluence.servlet.download.ServeAfterTransactionDownload.getStreamInTransaction(ServeAfterTransactionDownload.java:36)
at com.atlassian.confluence.servlet.download.ServeAfterTransactionDownload.serveFile(ServeAfterTransactionDownload.java:42){noformat}
h3. Notes
 * JIRA Activity Stream gadget can render the attachment correctly when JIRA 7.3.3 is integrated with Confluence 5.10.5
 * The same URL is used for linking the attachment when integrated with Confluence 5.10.5 and 6.1.0, for example {{[http://10.60.2.82:8090//download/attachments]}}

h3. Workaround

Open the attachment link in a new tab and remove one of the 2 forward slashes between the Base URL and _download/attachments_. E.g. from:
 * {{[http://10.60.2.82:8090//download/attachments]}}

to
 * {{[http://10.60.2.82:8090/download/attachments]}}
fields.summary: Broken Attachment Link in JIRA Activity Stream Gadget

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The first time you use Edit in Office in Firefox Microsoft Office opens and allows for editing the document. The second time it fails.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.10.0 and higher
* OfficeConnector-5.0.0.jar or higher
* Latest Firefox
* Office 2010

!2017-3-2-16-48-57-834.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit an office document by using the Edit it Office feature
# Save it
# Edit another office document by using the Edit it Office feature

h3. Expected Results
Each time Edit in Office is used, the document opens correctly.

h3. Actual Results
This error is shown on the second edit

!error.JPG|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
The steps in this document  have been tried
* [Edit In Office Documents Fail To Open In Word Excel And Url Shows Ms Word Ofe U Http Link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/edit-in-office-documents-fail-to-open-in-word-excel-and-url-shows-ms-word-ofe-u-http-link-816876999.html]

This was working in versions OfficeConnector-3.4.17.jar and lower.

Also note information from Microsoft about the URL Scheme as it refers to Office 2010 SP2
* https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/office/dn906146.aspx
{quote}
The scheme is supported in Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 2 and later, including the Microsoft Office 2013 for Windows and the Microsoft SharePoint 2013 products.
{quote}

See workaround for more notes.

h3.Workaround 1
The first time Edit in Office is used, in Firefox the plugin is empty and has no options (this is a screenshot from linux, but the idea is the same)

!screenshot-of-WebDav.png|thumbnail! 

The second time Edit in Office is used, the WebDAV launcher has an entry for the type of file and path to the executable. Deleting the entry allows Edit in Office to be used.

h3.Workaround 2
Upgrade to Office 2010 SP2.

h3. Workaround 3
Use IE11.
fields.summary: Edit in Office fails with incorrect Office URI Schemes
